member.summary: Disk Adapter utilizing ISCSIClient

member.name: M:ISCSI.Client.ISCSISession.GetNextTaskTag
member.summary: Allocate Initiator Task Tag

member.name: T:ISCSI.DefaultParameters
member.summary: Default operational parameters for iSCSI session / connection, as specified in RFC 3720.

member.name: F:ISCSI.DefaultParameters.Session.MaxConnections
member.summary: The maximum number of connections per session.

member.name: F:ISCSI.DefaultParameters.Session.InitialR2T
member.summary: Allow the initiator to start sending data to a target as if it has received an initial R2T

member.name: F:ISCSI.DefaultParameters.Session.MaxBurstLength
member.summary: The total of all the DataSegmentLength of all PDUs in a sequence MUST not exceed MaxBurstLength. Maximum SCSI data payload in bytes in a Data-In or a solicited Data-Out iSCSI sequence (i.e. that belongs to a single command). Irrelevant to the target in general, the initiator instructs us using ExpectedDataTransferLength.

member.name: F:ISCSI.DefaultParameters.Session.FirstBurstLength
member.summary: The total of all the DataSegmentLength of all PDUs in a sequence MUST not exceed FirstBurstLength for unsolicited data. Maximum amount in bytes of unsolicited [SCSI] data an iSCSI initiator may send to the target during the execution of a single SCSI command. Irrelevant to the target in general, irrelevant when (InitialR2T = Yes and) ImmediateData = No.

member.name: F:ISCSI.DefaultParameters.Session.DefaultTime2Wait
member.summary: Minimum time, in seconds, to wait before attempting an explicit/implicit logout after connection termination / reset.

member.name: F:ISCSI.DefaultParameters.Session.DefaultTime2Retain
member.summary: Maximum time, in seconds after an initial wait (Time2Wait), before which an active task reassignment is still possible after an unexpected connection termination or a connection reset.

member.name: F:ISCSI.DefaultParameters.Connection.MaxRecvDataSegmentLength
member.summary: Maximum data segment length that the target or initator can receive in an iSCSI PDU. Per direction parameter that the target or initator declares. The default MaxRecvDataSegmentLength is used during Login.

member.name: T:ISCSI.ISCSIConnectionReceiveBuffer
member.summary: iSCSI Connection Receive Buffer

member.name: M:ISCSI.ISCSIConnectionReceiveBuffer.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.param: bufferLength should be set to BasicHeaderSegmentLength + TotalAHSLength + HeaderDigestLength + MaxRecvDataSegmentLength + DataDigestLength. (because DataSegmentLength MUST not exceed MaxRecvDataSegmentLength for the direction it is sent)

member.name: M:ISCSI.ISCSIConnectionReceiveBuffer.DequeuePDU
member.summary: HasCompletePDU must be called and return true before calling DequeuePDU

member.name: M:ISCSI.ISCSIConnectionReceiveBuffer.DequeuePDUBytes
member.summary: HasCompletePDU must be called and return true before calling DequeuePDUBytes

member.name: M:ISCSI.Server.ConnectionManager.SendKeepAlive
member.summary: This method will check for dead peers (initiators). Because TCP broken connections can only be detected by sending data, we send a NOP-In PDU, If the connection is dead, the send failure will trigger the necessary connection termination logic. See: http://blog.stephencleary.com/2009/05/detection-of-half-open-dropped.html

member.name: T:ISCSI.Server.ConnectionState
member.summary: iSCSI Connection state object

member.name: T:ISCSI.Server.ISCSIServer
member.summary: an iSCSI server that can serve multiple iSCSI targets

member.name: M:ISCSI.Server.ISCSIServer.#ctor
member.summary: Server needs to be started with Start()

member.name: M:ISCSI.Server.ISCSIServer.Start(System.Int32)
member.param: The port on which the iSCSI server will listen

member.name: M:ISCSI.Server.ISCSIServer.Start(System.Net.IPEndPoint,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.param: The endpoint on which the iSCSI server will listen

member.name: M:ISCSI.Server.ISCSIServer.ResetTarget(System.String)
member.summary: Will terminate all TCP connections to all initiators (all sessions will be terminated)

member.name: F:ISCSI.Server.ISCSIServer.DefaultCommandQueueSize
member.summary: - CommandQueueSize = 0 means the initiator can send one command at a time (because MaxCmdSN = ExpCmdSN + CommandQueueSize), (in this case there won't be any queue following the currently processed command). - Over a low-latency connection, most of the gain comes from increasing the queue size from 0 to 1 - CmdSN is session wide, so CommandQueueSize is a session parameter.

member.name: F:ISCSI.Server.ISCSISession.m_nextTransferTag
member.summary: Target Transfer Tag: There are no protocol specific requirements with regard to the value of these tags, but it is assumed that together with the LUN, they will enable the target to associate data with an R2T.

member.name: M:ISCSI.Server.ISCSISession.IsFirstCmdSNPreceding(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns true if cmdSN1 should be executed before cmdSN2

member.summary: Caller MUST obtain a lock on TargetList.Lock before calling this method

member.name: M:Utilities.SocketUtils.ReleaseSocket(System.Net.Sockets.Socket)
member.summary: Socket will be forcefully closed, all pending data will be ignored, and socket will be deallocated.
